fields.story: **Hello my friends, I will not talk for long. I am Hazar from the north of Gaza City. I am collecting donations for my family after we lost our work, our home, and many of our family members in this devastating war that is approaching a year ago. I appeal to everyone who has an ounce of mercy in their hearts to save what is left of my family and to help and support them in purchasing the simplest things. The necessities and needs of life. At first I wanted to collect donations for them to get them out of Gaza and reach safety, but the army has besieged them from all places and my family is suffering from severe famine without water or food. It is up to your humanity. Donate even a little.**

fields.story:
My name is Umm Munther , a mother of five children: Noor, Maya, Hala, Munther, and Yazan.

We have lost everything in this war. Our home has been completely destroyed, leaving us homeless and forced to live on the streets. We have no access to food, clean water, clothing, or even the most basic necessities of life.

We are now facing famine conditions, and my children are suffering daily. As a mother, it breaks my heart to see them hungry, scared, and without shelter.

I am pleading for your support. Your donation can help us survive, provide food, clothing, and shelter, and give my children a chance at a dignified life.

Please, if you can, donate and share. Every contribution, no matter how small, can make a life-saving difference.

This fundraiser was created and is managed by Eisha Eman.

fields.story:
Ahmed Mosleh Abu Alkhair is a 30 year old man supporting his wife and two children, Ghina who is 6 years old and a 2 month old baby named Rakan - these young children will need help securing essentials. Due to the high inflation costs, the price of diapers is currently at around $50 a pack, and other necessities like baby formula are challenging to find.
Ahmed's home and place of shelter was entirely bombed by Israeli forces and they are now displaced in a tent. Due to the closing of the border and loss of aid and food in Palestine the last 3 months, the prices of basic necessities have reached an impossible high - a bag of flour can cost up to $300-$400 and a singular onion costs $10.

fields.story:
I am Hazem Al-Ghussein, a 25-year-old musician from Gaza. Music has always been my passion and my way of expressing hope and resilience. But the recent war destroyed everything I had built—my music project, my instruments, and even the studio where I worked.

Despite the pain and devastation, I didn’t stop using my voice and my strings to help the children who survived the genocide. I sang for them, played music for them, and tried to bring them moments of joy in the midst of suffering. Music was our refuge, our shared language against fear and destruction.

Hi, my name is Rachel. I’m organizing this fundraiser for my dear friend Jamal, his newborn daughter Thalj, and their family of 15. They are now all living in a tent together after their family home was bombed. During the bombing that destroyed their home, Jamal’s father was critically wounded and bled to death in front of them, as they stayed by his side, helpless to do anything to keep him with them on this earth. Later, his father's grave site was destroyed, and Jamal was forced to move his father's final resting place — a pain no human should endure.

**On June 9th, 2025, a tiny, beautiful soul entered this world. Jamal’s wife gave birth to their daughter, Thalj, which means “snow.”**
For Thalj's family, her birth is a miracle, a source of light in the darkest of times. They are doing everything in their power to find the essentials she needs: baby formula, clean clothes, diapers, safe shelter. But everything in Gaza has become unimaginably expensive. Prices have skyrocketed due to the blockade. What little remains is often sold at prices far beyond what most families can afford, especially those who have lost everything. Her family simply cannot afford her needs alone; let alone money to feed and care for their additional 14 family members.

Now, baby Thalj — just two months old — is growing up in a tent, exposed to the scorching heat by day, freezing temperatures by night, and the constant sound of drones and bombs overhead. There is no safe space for her, no steady supply of formula, no medicine. Her family is trying everything to care for her and their remaining loved ones, but in Gaza, food prices have become impossible, and survival depends entirely on outside support.

During one FaceTime call with Jamal, his brother burst into the tent having returned safely from the GHF aid zone carrying a single bag of flour. **_The family hadn’t eaten in five days._ **They started jumping and cheering. His brother collapsed, drenched in sweat, but safe. This is how rare food is now for the people of Palestine.

**_This GoFundMe is their only source of income. _**They are relying entirely on the kindness of strangers and that people like you will care. They’ve lost nearly everything—except hope. And you can help keep that hope alive.

Every single donation goes directly to Jamal and his family — to buy food, diapers, medicine, formula, and basic survival needs.

**From Jamal (Thalj’s father):**
**Hello. I'm Jamal Rouk from Gaza, Palestine. My wife gave birth to a new baby girl during the war. Part of my family was killed, and my home was destroyed. I hope you won't ignore me. I need help to buy food and medicine. The money you send could save my life, my daughter's life, and the life of my family. Please don’t leave us alone.**

This family is so full of love, resilience, and gratitude. Despite having lost so much, they continue to hope. Please don’t scroll past. Every single dollar can mean the difference between life and death for them — especially for baby Thalj.

**If you’ve ever wondered if your donation matters: this is where it matters most. Right here. Right now.**

Thank you from the bottom of my heart.
Free Palestine
— Rachel

fields.story:
Hanin is only 16 years old.  **Hanin and their family in G-Strip**. **Palestinians need you now. Not tomorrow, not next week, but now as starvation is an imminent danger.** What little is left in their markets is very expensive, with staples like bags of flour ranging from 200-500 euros, fresh produce anywhere from 50-100 euros per item, and medicine anywhere from 100-200 euros. Tents for shelter, meaning to avoid sleeping in rubble, is 200-400 euros. To confirm your suspicions, yes, price gouging is in full effect in G-Strip. If you can afford to pay for one necessity in full, Hanin and I both welcome you to. But if not, literally every cent counts. We can raise funds to meet their goal one dollar at a time, so all hands on deck for Palestine! All funds will be transferred when the goal is met.

A message from Hanin:

Hey, I'm Hanin. My family and I need help with food, medicine, winter clothing, etc. We are a family with children who have suffered appalling carnage in this genocide. Our home was reduced to rubble, and we are currently in a tent. Winter is here, and it's very dangerous. Please help if you can.

fields.story: His selflessness and determination to help his loved ones is unwavering, as he spent endless hours campaigning for his family's safety. Now is the time to move forward in rebuilding Ibrahim's future.

Adel is the owner of the largest chain of natural juice shops in Gaza, and Lina is a computer engineer specializing in motion graphics videos, voice-over, and content writing. However, after the destruction we faced, we are now without work, without a home, and without any source of income. Our businesses, which once provided us with a decent living, have been completely destroyed. Today, we need your help to start over.

Since the end of the ceasefire, daily living expenses have become drastically inflated. Sami is the main supporter of his family and he is helping his mother take care of his two younger siblings. They have survived several displacements and now are struggling to survive a famine.
fields.Personal Story:
Since the end of the ceasefire, daily living expenses have become drastically inflated. Sami is the main supporter of his family and he is helping his mother take care of his two younger siblings. They have survived several displacements and now are struggling to survive a famine.
The funds raised will be used to purchase food and supplies to sustain daily life in Palestine, with no aid entering the cost of survival has increased exponentially:
• The cost of flour is $500 - $700 USD
• The cost of laundry soap is $60 - $50 USD
• The cost of shampoo is $50 - $80 USD
• The cost of one apple is $15 USD
• The cost of one tent is $1500 - $5000 USD
• The cost of displacement to move from one location to a new "safe zone" costs $500 - $1000 USD———————————————————————————————————————Here is a message from Sami:
Hello, I am Sami from Palestine. I am only 19 years old and I lost my home and my job. I live with my mother and two siblings. I used to work in a supermarket and save money for my family through this work. Before the war, I was professionally studying in an Industrial College in the Home Appliance Maintenance Department, but my college was destroyed.
Unfortunately, my future I planned for has been completely destroyed. I have been displaced several times throughout this war. In the beginning, I was displaced from Palestine to the town of Nuseirat, then to Rafah, then to Deir al-Balah, the Eastern region, then to this strange area we are in now. Unfortunately, we have to live in tents, and our lives have become very difficult, and life is very expensive. I hope that you will help me by donating to save my family from the war.   We greatly appreciate any support you can offer and if you cannot donate, please consider sharing the campaign.

fields.story:
Amid unimaginable hardship, Mohamed represents the resilience of the human spirit.
Mohamed faces these challenges with remarkable courage and determination.
Mohamed is a 3D Artist, from Gaza, with a strong passion for his expression of visual aesthetics and creativity in how he perceives circumstances in life. Yet, the current circumstances he finds himself in with his family, consisting of 6 children and wife: In the middle of atrocities being committed to them and their people of Gaza. While holding the strong foundation of family, steadfastness, and compassion, Mohamed and his family continuously portray the virtues of humanity at its core.
Their plan for rebuilding is both practical and hopeful:
Currently, he and his family are seeking to reestablish their lives in an environment where their children can learn, their family can live, and their creative hearts can blossom.
Every donation, no matter the size, brings Mohamed closer to safety and stability.
Your support provides more than financial aid—it offers hope, dignity, and the chance for Mohamed to rebuild with strength and purpose.

fields.story:
I am Ahmed Al-Sir, 38 years old, married to Lubna Al-Sir, 30 years old, and we have three children.ars old
** Mohammed, Hassan, and Yazan.**
We were living a quiet life with our children in our new house that was built in 2019.The remaining construction installments have not been paid
**I was working as a sports trainer and my wife was an accountant in a company Our children are completing their education in their schools. In one day and one night, our lives were turned upside down and we were left on the street without a home. **
**During the night, rockets and artillery shells rained down on our residential area without warning, forcing us to flee our homes **
**We took nothing with us but our exhausted and tired souls. **
This is how the first displacement began until we reached the fifth displacement, and between them are stories and endless pain
**We miraculously survived with our three children and are now living in a tent on the sidewalk. Without any means of life**
**My children are deprived of education, safety, and a stable life. They are deprived of their most basic rights: food and safety. **
**In this war, my husband and I lost our jobs. In this war, we lost our livelihood.**

**Let me tell you what my children are going through in the tents. My son Mohammed, 11 years old, is supposed to be in school and take his lessons, but in this war, because of viruses, insects, and dust, the effects of infection have been felt. Then he got an infection, but there's no medicine, no food, and no healthcare.**
**My son, Yazan, two years **
**It is difficult for us to provide him with milk, diapers and health vaccinations. **
**My son, Hassan, 8 years old, is standing in line in the middle of the crowd to get food. In addition to the rising prices and shortages of cleaning supplies,**
**There are many, many endless sufferings and barriers that we and our children are trying to overcome in this war. **
**Every night I hug my children and wish to escape on the wings of angels to a safe place where children have everything we need. We are tired. We are tired of loss, tired of destruction, and living on the sidewalks.**

**Support, share, and don't hesitate.**
 
For those whose story of escape was not complete, because they were able to capture my husband and he is now their prisoner after he was injured in his feet from the bombing. My family is now without a father, without a breadwinner for us, in light of this war and this catastrophic famine.

fields.story: This fundraiser was set up on behalf of Mohammed, his wife Islam, and their three young children. Mohammed and I know each other for a long time now, and every cent raised is transferred directly to him and his family to help cover the extremely high cost of living in Gaza. Once the border crossings reopen, the funds raised will be used to help them leave the Gaza Strip.

fields.story:
Hi,
My name is Luka and I am from the United States. I created this GoFundMe on behalf of my friend Hussam, a 30 year old Palestinian man from Gaza. All of the funds from this campaign go to Hussam and his family, which consists of six people.
This campaign was created to help Hussam’s family afford food, clean water, medication, and other essential supplies they urgently need to survive during this ongoing genocide. The funds will help them buy these essential supplies.
This fundraiser is meant to support both their immediate survival inside Gaza and their efforts to raise enough money to evacuate together as soon as possible.
Any amount you can donate is deeply appreciated and if you can’t donate at this time, please share the GoFundMe with somebody that can donate.
If you have any questions, feel free to contact me via the button below that says contact campaign creator.

fields.story:
Yasmine's life has been turned upside down by the ongoing war. Her family's home was completely destroyed, along with both of her jobs—their only sources of income. She is now left with nothing but the clothes she and her children were wearing when they fled. They have been living in a tent under the scorching sun, without shelter, security, or access to the most basic necessities.
To make matters even more difficult, Yasmine is pregnant, and her daughter recently gave birth under these dire conditions. Her newborn granddaughter urgently needs prescription formula and diapers, while her other young children often go without enough nutritious food. Prices for basic supplies in Gaza have soared beyond reach, and the family has no means to afford them.
We are trying to raise €20,000 in donations to support Yasmine and her children with:
Emergency food, formula, and baby supplies
Temporary shelter to protect them from extreme heat
Clothing and essential household items
Support for urgent medical needs during and after pregnancy
Assistance to begin rebuilding their lives after total loss
I will personally ensure that every donation goes directly to Yasmine. I am in regular contact with her, and together we will make sure these funds are used transparently and with care to meet her family's most urgent needs.
Yasmine is a devoted mother fighting to protect her children in a place where survival is a daily struggle. With your help, we can give them a chance at safety, health, and dignity.
If you are able, please consider donating. Every contribution—no matter the size—will make a real difference for this family. And if you can't donate, sharing this campaign could help it reach someone who can.
Thank you for standing with them in their time of need.
With heartfelt gratitude,

I will personally ensure that every donation goes directly to Yasmine. I am in regular contact with her, and together we will make sure these funds are used transparently and with care to meet her family's most urgent needs.
Yasmine is a devoted mother fighting to protect her children in a place where survival is a daily struggle. With your help, we can give them a chance at safety, health, and dignity.
If you are able, please consider donating. Every contribution—no matter the size—will make a real difference for this family. And if you can't donate, sharing this campaign could help it reach someone who can.
Thank you for standing with them in their time of need.
With heartfelt gratitude,

Malek is a 12 year old girl who is the breadwinner for her family and she is trying to help her malnourished mother not have a miscarriage. They need food and they need shelter as soon as possible. They are in the heat of the Sun and soon to be the cold of the winter. This family needs intervention as soon as possible.

fields.story:
Rateb Quffa, and his wife, Haneen, and their two kids— 7-year-old Adam and 3-year-old Amira—and Rateb’s parents are fighting to survive in Gaza. Rateb’s mother, Faryal, had back surgery right before the war and hasn’t healed due to lack of care. For nearly two years, they’ve gone without steady access to food, water, or medicine. Given the blockade, prices in Gaza are so expensive that they are unable to afford them. Once the borders reopen, Rateb and his family will evacuate to Egypt.

Every donation helps. Funds go directly to the family for essentials like food, clean water, and clothing. Please donate what you can, and share this emergency fundraising with your friends and family. Follow @rateb\_quffa2 on Instagram (his new account) to see the impact of your support.

This family has been VERIFIED THAT THEY ARE IN GAZA through a call to Rateb.
My name is Nicole Wan, and I am a friend of the Quffa family. I am from the United States--GoFundMe is not available in Gaza, which is why I am helping facilitate this website. 100% of the money raised in this fundraiser will be wired to Rateb's bank account. Rateb and I met through mutual friends that volunteer to help the crisis in Gaza. Last year his emergency aid fund was shut down, so I reopened it on this page. I am raising money for Rateb’s family because I want to do what I can to protect human rights. No one should ever be forced to exist in these conditions.

fields.story:
We are a family of ten living in Gaza. We used to live a simple, peaceful life, but the war changed everything. Our lives were turned upside down by the ongoing conflict, and our daily concerns became securing food, shelter, and safety for our children.
The father, who worked as a driver, lost his job due to the war and was no longer able to support the family. The mother, who owned a beauty salon, also lost her job due to the war.
Our children need healthcare, but we struggle to secure even basic necessities like food and clean water. The dream of a decent life for them has become increasingly elusive.

**_Our goal is to raise funds to help us:_**
Providing safe and stable housing for the family.
Buying basic food items to meet our daily needs.
Providing necessary health care for family members.
Improving our living conditions in general so that we can live with dignity.

Greetings everyone!
My name is Enzo and I'm making this kitty to help Rami Abu who's trying to collect donations to rebuild houses and pay for food which is cruelly lacking. Absolutely everything is cheap at closing time for humanitarian aid.
Thank you for your Humanity

fields.story: **I'm Majd Mohammad Amin Abu Ghaben, an intern dentist, fresh graduate, the 4th graduate among 6 doctors brothers, citizen of occupied Palestine, currently residing in the Gaza Strip**. I am contacting you today after nearly more than 250 days of war and hell in Gaza and displacement more than 7 times from one place to another with a request for help. A call for survival, and a call for a future for me and my extended family.

fields.story:
My name is Mohammed, and I work as a neonatal nurse in the nursery department at Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital in Gaza. For years, I have dedicated my life to caring for the most fragile lives—newborns, premature babies, and infants under one year old. Even during the Israeli aggression, I worked tirelessly around the clock to ensure these vulnerable newborns received the care they desperately needed. I’ve seen firsthand how even in the darkest moments, the resilience of the human spirit shines brightest through the innocent smiles of these tiny miracles.

Today, I turn to you, not just as a nurse, but as a husband and father. My wife, Islam, and I have three beautiful children—Adam (3 years old), Hussein (6 years old), and Amira (9 years old). Like so many families in Gaza, we have lost everything during the recent conflict. Our home was reduced to rubble, and with it, all the essentials we worked so hard to provide for our children.

The challenges we now face are overwhelming. Rebuilding our lives feels like an impossible task, but we believe in the power of compassion and community to help us start anew.

**What your support will achieve:**

- **Leaving the Gaza Strip: **Unfortunately, the borders remain closed and, when they were open, leaving the Gaza Strip was associated with high costs. The money raised will help us cover part of these expenses and begin anew somewhere in peace.
- **Providing essentials:** Everything we owned—clothing, furniture, school supplies, and basic necessities—has been lost. Your generosity will help us replace these items to meet our family’s everyday needs.
- **Getting our children back to school: **Amira, Hussein, and Adam deserve a chance to continue their education and rebuild their futures. Your help will ensure they have the supplies, uniforms, and stability needed to return to school with dignity, when possible.
- **Supporting my work:** Stability at home will allow me to continue my work as a nurse, caring for the most vulnerable babies in our community. This is not just about rebuilding my family—it’s about giving back to a community that is struggling together.

**Why now?**

This moment is critical. The Israeli aggression is worsening by the day. There’s barely any food left, and when you do find some, the cost is prohibitively high. If we have to leave at a moment’s notice, we’ll need funds to start anew and survive without any of our belongings. Every donation, no matter the size, brings us closer to safety, stability, and hope.

**Your impact**

By supporting our family, you’re not only helping us rebuild our lives—you’re enabling a father to care for his children, a mother to nurture her family, and a nurse to continue saving lives. Together, we can show that even in the face of devastation, humanity, kindness, and solidarity can overcome any hardship.

From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you for considering our story and for standing with us during this difficult time. Your generosity means more than words can express—it means hope, resilience, and a future for our children.

With deepest gratitude,
Mohammed, Islam, Adam, Hussein and Amira

fields.Notes: Hello, how are you my dear? ❤️ My name is Hala from Gaza. I have two children, Mounes, 4 years old, and Mohammed, 1.5 years old. God blessed me with a daughter named Rawya, but she passed away. Thank God, my house was bombed, and my tent burned recently because of the bombing. I live with people. If you could donate to my children and help me get a tent, and send the link to your friends, I would be grateful to you for the rest of my life. May God protect you from all evil. 😭😭Forgive me, my children go to bed hungry 😭😭🙏
fields.story:
My name is Hala… a mother who lost everything, and all I have left is the embrace of my children.
I used to live a simple life… a small home, a car, and dreams growing with the laughter of my boys, Moanis and Mohammad.
But war didn’t ask if I was ready.
In a single moment, my house was destroyed, my car was burned, and every dream I built with my hands turned to ashes.

Hello everyone , My name is Diyaa , I am 28 years old, and I live in Gaza—or at least, I used to. I am the sole provider for my family of 9 people, including my wife. We were trying to live a simple life despite the difficult conditions, until everything was destroyed by the ongoing war.
Our home was completely demolished, and we have been displaced more than 7 times in search of safety. But in Gaza, there is no safe place. We now live in dire humanitarian conditions, suffering from hunger, lack of food, clean water, and medicine, with no source of income.
During this war, both my brother and I were injured. My brother was shot in the face while trying to get a bag of flour from one of the aid centers, just to save our family from starvation. The bullet went through his face, causing a devastating injury that disfigured him and changed his life forever. I was also injured, but I continue to do everything I can to provide the bare minimum for my family.
We have lost everything:
- Our home
- Our livelihood
- Our sense of safety
- Our health
- Our dignity
I write to you today with a heart full of pain, asking for your support — any amount, no matter how small, can help me buy food and medicine for my family, treat my brother’s injury, and keep us alive in the midst of this nightmare.
Your kindness could mean the world to us.

Greetings, everyone! My name is Saber Alasmar, and I work as an ICU doctor at Nasser Medical Complex in Khanyounis ,southern of Gaza Strip. I want to share with you the immense challenges my family and I face as we strive to raise funds for our evacuation to Egypt in order to ensure our safety and survival.

Walid Zaki Atiya is more than a statistic. He is a father, a son, and a survivor from the Gaza Strip, Palestine, who has endured unimaginable loss and is fighting to keep his family together.
### **A Life in Ruins**
The war shattered Walid’s home, leaving him and his five‑member family—his wife, three children, and a mother suffering from a chronic illness—without shelter or resources. Today they live in a tent, a stark reminder of how quickly security can vanish. Walid’s mother requires continuous medical treatment and medication, yet no one is currently able to meet these essential needs.

### **Why Walid Needs Your Help**
- **Medical Care for a Sick Mother:** Ongoing treatment and medication are critical to keep her alive and stable.
- **Basic Necessities:** Food, clean water, clothing, and temporary shelter are urgently required.
- **Financial Support:** Without any source of income, Walid’s family is unable to afford even the most basic items.
### **How Your Support Can Make a Difference**
Your contribution will do more than provide financial aid—it offers hope, restores dignity, and empowers Walid to rebuild his life with strength and purpose. Even a modest donation can:
1. **Cover the cost of life‑saving medication for his mother.**
2. **Provide a reliable source of food and water for the family.**
3. **Help secure more stable shelter as they transition from a tent.**
### **Join Walid on the Path to Safety and Renewal**
Every dollar, every word of encouragement, and every share of Walid’s story brings us closer to a future where he and his family can thrive again. Please consider donating, sharing, or volunteering your time to help Walid Zaki Atiya and his family regain their footing and rebuild their lives.
_Your support is a lifeline, a beacon of hope, and a testament that the world still cares._

fields.story:
My name is Muhannad. I'm 24 years old. I live in a city that only sleeps to the sounds of shelling, and wakes up to a fragile hope that amounts to nothing more than a missing pill or a loaf of bread we waited in a long line for.

In Gaza, everything is postponed: dreams, travel, studies, and even love. We live half a day with a charged battery, and the rest by candlelight or broken screens.

I try to be strong, to smile when my mother asks me, "What's up?" I lie and say, "Thank God, everything is fine." She knows I'm lying, but we lie to survive.

I dream of leaving, not as an escape, but in search of a life that resembles life. I dream of a home uninhabited by the sounds of airplanes, and a night unbroken by explosions. I dream of saying my name, Muhannad, without anyone hearing me ever thinking "refugee."

But here I am staying. Between the smell of the sea and gunpowder, I write, I breathe, and I try to remain human.

fields.story: My name is Ayham Rock, I am 16 years old from the village of Khuza'a in Gaza, Palestine. The occupation destroyed my beautiful village, and bombed the house where I grew up with my mother, father, three brothers and two sisters: Ayham (16), Yusra (13), Rahaf (20), Adham (24), Malek (23), my mother (48), and my father (53). Here we were displaced from our village of Khuza'a to the Rafah area (near the Egyptian border). We live in a displacement tent. We have been here for 260 days of suffering and pain, and the situation is very difficult. I cannot describe to you the enormous suffering we are living here. We suffer from a lot of fear and tension. The sounds of explosions are heard everywhere, and we suffer from high food prices, medical neglect, shortages of medicines, the spread of infectious diseases, and the lack of safe drinking water. Two of my sisters have been exposed to infectious diseases that threaten their lives, so we cannot live in the Gaza Strip. In other words, the Gaza Strip is uninhabitable. In this war, I lost many of my friends and some of my cousins. I lost my education and my future. My home and my beautiful memories were destroyed. I have nothing now. Our lives have been threatened with death more than once. I don't know if we will survive the Rafah invasion.

We moved to my sister's house and we escaped from death since the house was target while we were inside. we had nowhere else to go, so we escaped north of Gaza to south near the border of Rafah.
We are currently living huddled in a small tent me, my mother, my two brothers, two sisters in law and 5 kids.
Everyday is a challenge, we have to search for water, food and wood so that we can cook.
My mom is having a health issues and needs medical follow up.
Our plan is simple but profound, to escape the horror we are living everyday. we want to live happily in a safer place.
we will be so happy and grateful for your help. we just want to pass through Rafah gate to Egypt and to do so we need to pay 5000 USD per person, this counts 11 members.
Your support will enables us to start and build a new life.

I finished my master’s degree and have many higher academic degrees. I had a job that ensured living in dignity. My family and I lived a decent life and all life’s requirements were fulfilled. Available to me I had a fine home I lost everything Unfortunately, I and my family were victims of the rabid war that the Gaza Strip was subjected to. We were expelled from my home, which I and my beautiful family used to live in.

fields.story:
Hello, my name is Suhaib Al-Hajjeen, and I’m 19 years old. I’m writing to you not just for myself, but for my entire family of ten. We are trapped under siege in Gaza, living through hunger, grief, and unimaginable hardship.
My eldest brother was killed in an airstrike.
Another of my brothers was severely burned while trying to get food from a communal kitchen.
A third brother was gravely injured—he had a kidney removed, along with part of his liver and intestine.
And I am also injured.
In the middle of this nightmare, I have tried to take responsibility for my family, but I have no way to earn an income. We cannot afford food. A single kilo of flour now costs 150 shekels (around $45), and even that is out of reach. We have no money for medicine, no clothes, and not enough food to survive.
Every day is a fight just to stay alive. My father is still with us, but we are all starving. We are all in pain. The war has taken our home, our security, and nearly all our hope.
Please, if you can, donate to help us afford food, medicine, and basic essentials. Even the smallest amount will mean the world to us.
This campaign is a lifeline. We have nowhere else to turn.
Thank you for reading and for standing with us in this time of need.
With hope,
Suhaib and family
📍Gaza Strip

fields.story:
I am Laila Muhammad from Gaza.
I have a family of eight people. We have young children and infants. We live in difficult circumstances, and the head of the family lost his source of income and work due to the war. We were displaced from our homes more than once and left behind our dreams and everything we owned. For a year and a half, we have not bought clothes for the children, we have not eaten good food, and we cannot buy milk or diapers for the baby.
The children cry in hunger, they have nothing to eat, and they sleep dreaming of food. They wake up at night crying because of bombing and explosions. We are tired of hunger, fear and displacement. We want a decent life for us and our children. We want the children to grow up safely and get the necessary education.
Please help my family obtain an amount through which we can build a business, from which we can earn money through which we can feed the children and make them feel safe.
Can you believe, my friend, that the price of flour exceeds $300? How will we feed them when we do not have clean water to drink? We adults sleep hungry and endure, but children do not...
I personally suffer from infections, abdominal pain, and stomach problems due to, firstly, contaminated water, and secondly, bad food.
fields.Personal Story:

I have a family of eight people. We have young children and infants. We live in difficult circumstances, and the head of the family lost his source of income and work due to the war. We were displaced from our homes more than once and left behind our dreams and everything we owned. For a year and a half, we have not bought clothes for the children, we have not eaten good food, and we cannot buy milk or diapers for the baby.
The children cry in hunger, they have nothing to eat, and they sleep dreaming of food. They wake up at night crying because of bombing and explosions. We are tired of hunger, fear and displacement. We want a decent life for us and our children. We want the children to grow up safely and get the necessary education.
Please help my family obtain an amount through which we can build a business, from which we can earn money through which we can feed the children and make them feel safe.
Can you believe, my friend, that the price of flour exceeds $300? How will we feed them when we do not have clean water to drink? We adults sleep hungry and endure, but children do not...
I personally suffer from infections, abdominal pain, and stomach problems due to, firstly, contaminated water, and secondly, bad food.

She is dedicated to finishing her high school year despite being in a very small tent with her large family In the heat of the summer and without the essentials a person needs to survive. Please help her fulfill her dreams and survive this. She is currently malnourished and experiencing health issues and despite this continues for studies. Please support her and donate if you can.

fields.story:
This is the Mousa family: the mother and father, Ahmad and Najwa, and their six children: Ibtisam, Nael, Mousa, Israa, and the twins Mai and Mohammad.

The Mousa family is among more than two million people currently displaced multiple times due to the ongoing and devastating bombardment. They have lost everything — their homes, their jobs — and have become unable to attend school or work. They are currently victims of war crimes (according to the International Criminal Court and the United Nations). They are being collectively punished through starvation, denial of medical care, clean water, and all the basic necessities of life because of the continuing aggression on their country.

The entire family needs your help.

The family was already scattered before, because of another bombing and the destruction of their home years ago. During that attack, their middle son, Mousa, who was only 14 at the time, suffered a stroke when their house was bombed. His brain injury continued, and his health deteriorated because there were no specialized doctors in their country to treat him.

Ibtisam, Mousa’s eldest sister and a nurse, read about specialists who might be able to help him, so she and Mousa made a dangerous sea journey, which eventually brought them to Belgium. There, Mousa received the treatment he so desperately needed. But eventually, he required a high-risk brain surgery that needed the consent of one of his parents. This pushed Ahmad to make the same dangerous sea journey — but fortunately, he made it to Belgium so he could sign for the surgery and care for Mousa.

Ahmad cannot work full-time because he is Mousa’s primary caregiver.

Ibtisam has not been able to find work as a nurse because Belgium does not recognize her nursing certificates from her country. She worked in other jobs until she gave birth to her second child. Now, her husband, Samhan, works extra weekend hours to send money to his family still in Gaza as well.

The family in Gaza needs significant funds to relocate to Belgium and to buy food — which is extremely expensive, if available at all. This process will be long and difficult. Meanwhile, the five family members still in Gaza are suffering from severe shortages of food, clean water, any kind of medical care, and proper shelter. They are living under constant bombardment and are forced to move frequently.

The entire family is in need of our help. While everyone is doing their best to send whatever extra money they can to the family in Gaza, the relatives already in Belgium also need our support.

Please help reunite this family, which has been separated for reasons beyond their control. They are one family that only hopes to live their life and fulfill the dreams they had before the current wave of aggression began nearly two years ago.

fields.story:
My name is Alaa Salama, a 31-year-old Palestinian from Gaza. My wife, Nabila (29 years old), and I were living a simple, modest life, dreaming of a better future for our two children—Sham (7 years old) and Mohammed (8 years old). Every morning, they used to go to school with bright smiles on their faces. We had a warm home filled with love, despite the challenges we faced.
But everything changed overnight.
Since the beginning of the recent war on Gaza, our life has become an endless nightmare. Our neighborhood was bombed, and we were forced to flee our home with nothing but our children in our arms, hoping just to stay alive. We’ve been moving from one place to another, desperately searching for safety—but there is no safe place here. There’s no electricity, no clean water, no food. My children ask me every day, “Baba, when can we go back home?”
Life here has turned into a daily fight for survival. We are suffering from severe shortages of food and medicine. My children are losing weight, struggling with hunger, fear, and cold. My wife Nabila does her best to stay strong in front of the kids, but she breaks down in tears every night when they fall asleep.
I am reaching out from the depths of my heart: please help us survive. Your donation will provide my family with food, medicine, and a safe place to stay. And maybe—just maybe—one day we can leave this war behind and start a new life somewhere safe.
Any support, no matter how small, can make a huge difference for us. We need you now more than ever.
Thank you for hearing our story and being a light in this darkness.

fields.story: Muhammad Al-Saba is 20 years old and is from far North of the Gaza Strip. His family consists of his father (Mahmoud, 54), mother (unsure), two sisters (Nada,23 and Samod 24), a brother(Thaer, 25) and a cute orange cat. Thaer was studying medicine in Egypt and is not in Gaza.
fields.Personal Story:
Muhammad Al-Saba is 20 years old and is from far North of the Gaza Strip. His family consists of his father (Mahmoud, 54), mother (unsure), two sisters (Nada,23 and Samod 24), a brother(Thaer, 25) and a cute orange cat. Thaer was studying medicine in Egypt and is not in Gaza.
Muhammad had just finished highscool before the war, with a strong GPA, and was studying at Palestine University to become a software engineer for about two months, then the genocide came.
They were forced to evacutate to the south on October 12th, and his family and his cat went to Rafah. A few days later they discovered there house was bombed for no reason.
On 5/25/2024, they were forced to evacuate Rafah and flee to Khan Yunis. two months later they wre forced to flee again to Deir Al-Balah due to the IOF adavancements.
Currently they live in a small tent with 6 people and thier cat. They are being told to evacuate further south, but this cost money. On top of that, they need basic supplies for food and water to survive.
His father was injured by Shrapnel which means Muhommad must step up. He and his cousin recently went to Zakim, where the death aid traps are. They wre unsuccesful, and his cousin was badly injured with a bullet in the foot. 
His grandma has also passes away from a heart attack due to the genocide.
Food and water is very expensive, and the "aid traps" are dangerous. Please donate so that Muhommad and his family can get food without having to risk their lives at these traps. In addition they need money to help them evacuate, and for medicine and treatment for his cousin and fathers injuries. I am asking to raise 10,000$ to provide this family with the assitance they need to make it out. Please donate anything you can and share with friends and family. Thank you.

fields.story:
"Hello, my name is Mustafa, and I am 23 years old, living in Gaza. Because of the war, my brother was martyred, leaving me solely responsible for supporting his two children, Mohammed and Zeina. I cannot support them with everything they need. The occupation forces have destroyed our home and their childhood, and now I cannot even supply them with food to eat. I lost my job from the bombs and destruction as well as the university I was attending. I beg you to stand with us and help us. The people of Gaza need you to extend a helping hand to them, even if it is a little. Be with us, and we hope that you will not let us down as the world has let us down."
This page is being made for my dear friend in Gaza, who is living out the toughest days of his life. God willing, this war will end soon, and we will see God's peace and love overcome every heart.

fields.story:
Our home has become rubble, and our lives have turned into a tragedy…
We need your support to live again.

We were four families living under one roof—a four-story house sheltering 25 people, including school and university students. This home was the fruit of many years of hard work by me and my brothers.

But the war spared nothing… Our house was completely destroyed, reduced to a pile of debris.

My father, the head of our family, lives with a disability and suffers from chronic health issues. He needs a wheelchair and constant care around the clock, in addition to medical treatments that we can no longer afford.

Abdulrahman, my nephew, is a 9-year-old boy who cannot speak. He used to receive psychological and rehabilitative therapy, which was halted due to the crisis. His main medication is no longer available, and we were forced to use an expensive alternative that is ineffective—his condition has worsened significantly.

Today, we face a heartbreaking reality:

12 children in the family are suffering from a lack of food, water, and medicine.

We lack the most basic essentials: clothing, blankets, kitchen supplies, and even safe shelter.

We have been displaced four times so far, and each time has cost us more than we can bear.

We can’t afford to rebuild our home, especially with retirement approaching and children still in university.

We tried to return home after the fighting stopped… but we found it completely destroyed. We couldn’t save anything. Even our memories were buried beneath the rubble.

Today, we are no longer asking to rebuild our house…
We are asking to survive.
We need your support to secure food, medicine, and temporary shelte

I am a civil engineer and I never imagined that one day I would ask for help from anyone, but the difficult circumstances we are going through are stronger than anything.

Your presence during this difficult time gives us hope and restores a part of our humanity.

Your donation—no matter how small—can make a real difference in our lives.
Let’s rebuild our lives together… step by step, and smile by smile.

fields.story:
My name is Wisam Al-Sharif. I am a father of three children living in Gaza under extremely difficult conditions due to the ongoing war. I am reaching out to you with deep hope and respect, after seeing the incredible support your foundation provides to Gaza’s children.

My son, Louay, is 12 years old and suffers from severe hearing loss. He urgently needs hearing aids, speech therapy, and medical follow-up to be able to hear and communicate like other children. Unfortunately, due to the current situation in Gaza, these services are unavailable.
We live without electricity, clean water is scarce and often contaminated, and schools have been closed for over two years. My children are growing up surrounded by fear, hunger, and silence. Financial access is nearly impossible — banks are closed and there is no income.

I am Maha, I have three children. I was displaced from the north of Gaza to the south. My husband went missing and I have not found him. I have no breadwinner or income. My dependents are young, their ages ranging from 16 to 7 years. I lost my entire home and now I live in a tent in the south.
I cannot provide any of the basic necessities of life. I depend on my son Anas for everything, and he is very young.

I am Walid Zaki Attia, a resident of Gaza Strip, Palestine. I used to live in a rented apartment, bu unfortunately, it was completely destroyed during the recent war. I am now displace and living in a tent with my family. My hunaitarian situatino is extremely difficult, and I currently have no source of income. I kindly request any assistance you can offer, either personally or through your friends or relatives. I am in urgent need of food and medicine for my sick mother. I sincerely hope you will consider my plea with compassion and humanity. May God bless you.

fields.story: Nour has endured unimaginable loss. She spent years working hard—first building a career in telecommunications, and then slowly building a home for her family. That home, along with her parents’ home, was reduced to rubble in the recent war on Gaza. She lost her job, her home, and several beloved members of her family.
fields.Personal Story:
Nour has endured unimaginable loss. She spent years working hard—first building a career in telecommunications, and then slowly building a home for her family. That home, along with her parents’ home, was reduced to rubble in the recent war on Gaza. She lost her job, her home, and several beloved members of her family.

In the midst of this devastation, Nour gave birth to her first child, Sami. Sami came into the world surrounded by heartbreak, hunger, and destruction—but also into the arms of a mother determined to protect him no matter what.

Today, Nour and Sami are living in a catastrophic situation. Food is nearly impossible to find, and prices are unbearably high. They have no stable shelter, no income, and no access to basic necessities. Nour is trying to care for her newborn in a place where survival itself is a daily battle.

We are urgently trying to raise $20,000 to help Nour and baby Sami with:

Emergency food and baby supplies
Basic living essentials and shelter
Safe evacuation from Gaza
A chance to rebuild their lives in safety and dignity
I will personally ensure that the funds go directly to Nour and her family. I am in regular contact with her, and together we will make sure every dollar is used to meet her most urgent needs.

This isn’t just about helping a mother and child survive—it’s about giving them a chance to live. A chance to heal, rebuild, and provide little Sami with the future every child deserves.

If you are able, please consider donating. Every contribution, no matter the size, can make a life-changing difference. And if you can’t donate, simply sharing this campaign can help Nour’s story reach someone who can.

Thank you so much for your compassion and solidarity.

fields.story: My name is Jassim Nayef from Gaza, Palestine. My family and I need help in order to create a small house that is full of the cold and homelessness. Please help me, even if there is a simple place. My family consists of 7 people. Where are the good people of good hearts? They help me secure food, drink and housing. We need 50,000 dollars in order to secure the necessities of life. The war affected it more than others. Look at the videos I publish that describe my situation. The donation is Yahya, a poor family who is tired of hunger, poverty and homelessness.

I am Hoda from Gaza, I am 24 years old. I was displaced at the beginning of the war from the north to the south, then to Rafah, then to Mawasi Khan Yunis. I live with my mother, my brother, his wife, and his two children. My dear father passed away when I was three years old. 
My brother is unemployed, and I was a lawyer before the war. I take care of my family through my work, but I lost my office, my work, and all my money in the war. I also take care of my sister’s child, who was born in this war, under difficult circumstances, where there is no healthy food or clean water, and everything is expensive.
I have one brother who is sick with a heart condition and unfortunately unemployed. My mother and I take care of him. He has an older son named Jamal and a baby girl he gave birth to during the war in February 2024. Her name is Jana. She is very sweet, but unfortunately she did not have a safe life. She was born under bombing and fear and had no clothes. Now Jana is one year old and she is trying to have a safe life like the rest of the children in the world.
Now I am taking care of my family: my mother, my brother and his children, my sister and her child. I am also trying to collect money so that I can complete my studies abroad and study for a master's degree if I can travel. 
Jana now needs milk and healthy food, as you know that food prices are very expensive. She needs clothes and supplies. She and her brother Jamal also need expenses, and their father, who is my brother, needs to buy medication every month that costs about **$150**, or **400 shekels** in the currency we use.

‏I cannot afford all these expenses, and I do not have a job now. I have lost everything, my profession as a lawyer, in this war. ‏We are suffering from lack of work and money in the war, so I made this donation campaign. We are now living with more than 10 people in a small tent and we need a new tent, but its price is $300. We do not have this money because everything we own goes to buy food, which has become twice as expensive as it was before the war.
We are living in a very bad situation, threatened with danger and death every minute.
Yes, I lost my home and I hope you will help me rebuild and restore it, as its restoration needs at least $10,000.
I also hope to collect a number of donations so that I can travel and save my family and complete my master’s studies in law abroad. I hope that you will donate to me and support my family.
We need your support and assistance.

fields.Personal Story: Update Story

fields.story:
I have a family of **6** **children living in Gaza**, we endured the heartbreak of our home being demolished by the Israeli occupation a couple of years ago. Now, tragedy strikes again as my kids' house was bombed during this war, leaving us without a place to call home. Desperation fills our days as I seek any means to save my children's lives and provide them a safe refuge with access to education and health, my last glimmer of hope in this troubled life. Your invaluable support can transform this simple dream into a reality for my family.

**Update: May 2024**

Amidst the bombing, we had to leave Rafah city again, not knowing where to go. We found ourselves among 15 families, huddled on a barren piece of land near Rafah Beach. Our makeshift tents offer no protection from the elements, and there's nothing to sustain us – no food, no water, not even a bathroom. Our children grow weaker by the day, falling ill with no medical care in sight. Each explosion nearby sends shivers down our spines, as we flee from one danger to another. Even here, near Rafah Beach, supposed to be a sanctuary, Israeli warships relentlessly fire at our tents, compounding our fear and insecurity. We are living a nightmare with no end in sight.

Once, we had hopes and dreams. Our eldest son, Yasr, was embarking on his university journey, full of optimism. Our daughters eagerly awaited the new school year, while our youngest ones were excited about kindergarten. My husband, a devoted teacher, poured his heart into his work, cherishing his students. Now, those dreams lie shattered, buried beneath the rubble of our former lives. We're adrift, with no past to cling to and an uncertain future looming ominously.

But amidst the despair, there's a flicker of hope – your support. With your help, we can rebuild not just our home in a safe secure place for my kids, but our lives. Your kindness can breathe life into our shattered dreams, offering us a chance at a future filled with hope and possibility.

**_The donation plan is structured as follows:_**

- **6 adults (Samir AlFere 46 years old, Sara AlFere 40 years old, Hayat AlFere 68 years old, Yaser AlFere 19 years old, Roa AlFere 17 years old, Rimas AlFere 15 years old), each adult requires $10,000 for the Egyptian border crossing.**
- **3 children (Mohammed AlFere 4 years old, Hayat AlFere 6 years old, Fadi AlFere 7 years old).**
- **Each child needs $5,000 for the same purpose.**
- The rest of money is for life costs, travel, rent, food, visa, and flight tickets expenses.

**_Additionally:_**

- **Transaction costs apply to each donation.**
- **Taxes must be paid for the total donation.**

Your compassionate contribution will not only help us overcome immediate challenges but also build a foundation for a secure and promising future for my family.

**Thank you for being the beacon of hope in our darkest hours...**
fields.Personal Story:
I have a family of **6** **children living in Gaza**, we endured the heartbreak of our home being demolished by the Israeli occupation a couple of years ago. Now, tragedy strikes again as my kids' house was bombed during this war, leaving us without a place to call home. Desperation fills our days as I seek any means to save my children's lives and provide them a safe refuge with access to education and health, my last glimmer of hope in this troubled life. Your invaluable support can transform this simple dream into a reality for my family.

fields.story: **_I am Ahmed Al-Qayyim.. I live in Italy..I am trying to help my aunt and her family escape from the war zone. My aunt's name is Salwa Mohammed Baroud and her husband is Hani Abdel Hamid Al-Mazin. She has 4 children and here is her story.... Hello... I am Salwa Mohammed Baroud, I am 40 years old. My husband, Hani Abdel Hamid Al-Mazin, is 43 years old. We have 4 children.Saja, 16 years old, Hussein, 13 years old, Abdul Hamid, 11 years old, and Mahmoud, 16 years old. Since our marriage, we have been living in a rented house. After 12 years, we went to live with my husband’s mother in the family home in the middle of the camp. We had hoped to live in an independent house far from the camp in a beautiful place. Despite the neighborhood…We were extremely happy and pleased. At the end of the weekends, we would go with the family on an outing or visit a relative for entertainment and fun. But after October 7, our dreams were shattered and we were displaced from our home. We were forced to...We own everything we love. We went out on the third day of the war in the middle of the night, fearing the bombing that hit our house and the houses next to us, leaving 20 innocent dead. By God, we were saved from the bombing by the planes, and we miraculously survived. We went to my husband’s brother’s house and…He was 6 months old, in addition to many displaced people with him. After that, we were displaced to my father’s house and stayed there for two months before the worst decision came, which was forcing us to leave the city. It was not enough for them to force us out of our homes. They asked us to leave our city.We were living in the great city of Rafah, which contained thousands of displaced people.The difficult decision has come, and I wish they had given us time and a chance to go out and get what we need of clothing and food. We fled under artillery shelling and rocket fire. We went out under fire and we also miraculously survived. We went out to another city and to certain places that the Israeli army had previously determined for us. They claim that they are safe, but... Places, there is no security or safety with them and in their presence. They followed us into the tents. Wasn’t the heat and fire of the tents enough for us, where the temperature is 50?Without any source of ventilation. Isn't it enough that insects are spreading due to the heat and diseases due to the lack of cleaning materials and the spread of sewage. Isn't it enough that there is a lack of water and food? We are living the worst days of our lives. Help us, even if it is a little, to escape from here. Searching_**

fields.story: Hello, I am Abdulaziz. I am 21 years old, and I am a physically disabled tour guide, a freelance videographer, a volunteer at the Reach Scholarship Education Fund, a student of cybersecurity engineering at UCAS, and a professional basketball player in Gaza. I faced many difficulties and challenges throughout my life, but I have remained persistent and determined to deliver the message of my people and to show everyone the beautiful heritage of my country. Unfortunately, the war came and destroyed everything I worked so hard for. My home, my job, my university, and my car (which made it easier for me to move due to my disability) have all been taken from me. Now, I am displaced from my city, and I have nothing but my hope left.

fields.story:
My name is Mohammed Jamal Zaki AlBana. I am a father of four young children living in Palestine, where we are facing unimaginable hardship due to the ongoing war. Our home has been damaged, our resources are depleted, and every day is a fight for survival.

I am reaching out for help—not only for myself and my children, but for our community, where families are struggling without food, clean water, shelter, or medical care. Your support will help us provide essential supplies, temporary shelter, and urgent aid to children and families devastated by this conflict.
This family is going through a challenging time and needs our community's support. Every donation, no matter the size, makes a meaningful difference in their lives.
fields.Personal Story: Update Story

fields.story:
I never imagined that one day I would be fighting not only for my life but also for a safe place to call home. During the brutal war, our house was completely destroyed by bombs. My family and I were forced to flee with nothing but the clothes on our backs. We became refugees in our own land, moving from one temporary shelter to another, never knowing where we would sleep the next night.

As if losing our home was not enough, I am now fighting cancer—a battle I cannot face alone. The hospitals here in Gaza are overwhelmed and the blockade means I cannot travel for the treatment I desperately need. Every day that passes without treatment brings me closer to losing hope, closer to losing my family. My children watch me suffer in silence, and their tears break my heart more than any pain I endure.

Adding to all this, the constant hunger is unbearable. In Gaza, many of us go to bed with empty stomachs.

Food is a scarce and the prices are too high for my family to afford. The hunger gnaws at our bodies while the uncertainty gnaws at our souls. The simplest things, like a warm meal or a safe place to rest, feel like distant dreams.

I feel so helpless and trapped. I want to live for my children, to see them grow up and to give them the childhood they deserve—a childhood free from fear, hunger, and suffering. But my body is weakening, and my spirit is breaking.

I am reaching out to you with a humble heart, hoping for a miracle. Your support can save my life and rebuild what was torn apart. It can give my children a roof over their heads and their mother’s smile again.

Please, don’t let war, disease, and hunger silence my story. Help me find the strength to keep fighting. Help me find a home again.

Every single donation brings a spark of hope in this darkness. From the bottom of my heart, thank you for your kindness and compassion.

fields.story: **Abdullah Zakaria is living in unimaginable conditions.** He has lost everything—his home, his stability, and now his health. On top of a life-threatening medical crisis, he is also facing severe food shortages while caring for his sick mother and young relatives. He is in desperate need of help to feed his family and stay alive.
